on_interact.51: Why are you hiding, my calf?
on_interact.56: Uh... well, I know how much 'ya like 'yer contemplatin' time, but I wanted 'ta talk.
on_interact.63: ... Come on out, now. Let's talk.
on_interact.72: So, I know 'ya said we Cattlekind ain't supposed to listen to those who live outside The Prairie, but I heard somethin' big's goin' on.
on_interact.77: There's been a decree, Pa. From the Council of Ungulates.
on_interact.92: I'm the leader of this herd, my calf. It's my duty to know such things.
on_interact.99: Then what's happenin', Pa? Why do we have 'ta pick a champion? And what for?
on_interact.104: The Mule Deer fawns are sayin' the most terrible things...
on_interact.110: Y'know, Arizona, I think a lot about what it means to be wanderers like us.
on_interact.115: Moving from place to place wherever the grass decides to grow, out here in the open air with no home except the wagons we haul and the hills we roam...
on_interact.123: Them city folk inside their walls only concern themselves with what's in front of their noses. The old stories... they took 'em out their history books.
on_interact.127: But our kind, Arizona, we're folk of the land. We remember, with our voices...

montage.19: ... all the hoofed folk of Foenum roamed together as one big ol' herd.
montage.23: And the world, well, it was one big ol' field where the grass was ours for the grazin'.
montage.27: We had a peace that lasted long as the tunnels of ten packs of prairie dogs. But times... they're always changin', yessir.
montage.33: You see, there were other animals on Foenum. Little ones. They had fur like us, but instead of hooves, they had gangly, clawed toes.
montage.37: Now, funny looking feet ain't usually cause for worry, but somethin' else was... their TEETH!
montage.41: And as time passed, these teeth grew longer and sharper than the thorns on a buffaloberry branch. And with chompers like that, well...
montage.47: ... I guess eatin' grass just wasn't gonna cut it. The Predators ripped our peace away quicker than a dandelion's seeds in a twister.
montage.51: But we didn't stand by like frightened jackrabbits to be gobbled up like buttered biscuits. Nope!
montage.61: So many of us were lost, we weren't sure if we'd've been better off just lettin' ourselves be their supper...
montage.65: But soon, we weakened those varmints well enough...
montage.71: That's when a mystic from the desert lands stepped in. Usin' her great power, she banished the Predators to some otherly place, lockin' them away.
montage.77: So that Key everyone's talkin' about...
montage.88: Well I'll be. So 'ya HAVE been payin' attention to my stories!
montage.97: The Predators were gone, but so was our peace. Our great herd of one broke into many. We were weakened, and we were scared...
montage.101: 'Cause though them Predators were locked up... it weren't for good. No sir.
montage.105: The monsters swore, as they were sucked up into the funnel of that deep, dark nothingness, that they'd be back. And they'd be...

texas_calls_for_champions.8: So, my compatriots... who among you will volunteer to face these hooligans?

ari_offers.20: Not too young to love my home! I'll do anything for The Prairie, Pa. And all of Foenum, too!

ari_offers.39: I won't allow it! I said NO!

FirstInteraction.5: Howdy! You the one in charge here?
FirstInteraction.13: Greetings, small horned one. I am Herd Leader Adobo. Are you well?
FirstInteraction.20: Oh uh... yeah. Thanks 'fer uh... savin' me an' all.
FirstInteraction.25: 'Fraid I'm gonna need 'ta ask 'fer some more help, though. I'm lookin' 'fer The Prophet's Key...
FirstInteraction.29: Ah yes. You are young, determined, with eyes still full of hope. You must be yet another following the Council's decree. We know of this.
FirstInteraction.36: We the Alpake Clan of the Huacaya Mountains are wretched and alone in this world...
FirstInteraction.40: ... But not so secluded that we haven't heard of the Toothed Ones, their return, and the search for the Key.
FirstInteraction.51: Adobo sir, will 'ya tell me what 'ya know?
FirstInteraction.59: I am sorry girl, but of the Key itself, we know nothing.
FirstInteraction.65: Mother Nature, she is heartless and cruel here in The Highlands. She provides little to drink. Little to eat. And little to warm ourselves but our own hides.
FirstInteraction.70: We have no choice but to care only for our own survival, not for old myths and legends.
FirstInteraction.83: Even if it is written all over the walls of the Ancient Ruins...

AboutQuest.2: Oh. The Ancient Ruins of our Ancestors.
AboutQuest.9: To reach them, you must first find the secret entrance into the Eternal Caves of Neverending Length.
AboutQuest.14: Then you must cross the Foggy Mountaintops, a maze of treacherous old bridges where the path ahead lies obscured in the mist.

on_interact.20: Reine City, Capital to the nation of The Tundra, just one of many nations in the world of...
on_interact.30: For the first time in countless generations, the Foenum Council of Ungulates has been reformed and now convenes to discuss a matter of utmost urgency...
on_interact.43: Fellow Ungulates, even and odd toed alike...
on_interact.48: We, the appointed Elders of our nations, are gathered here today to discuss the disturbing rumors that have been circulating across all of Foenum.
on_interact.52: And to bear witness, we have found...
on_interact.77: Do not be frightened, small one. Tell us what you saw.
on_interact.84: Yes, ma'am. You see, I was back home in The Savanna, just before dawn.
on_interact.91: I woke up early that morning when I felt a firefly tickle my nose.
on_interact.95: I chased it through the tall grass. Just, you know... playin' around...
on_interact.99: Anyway, it took me all the way to the watering hole... and that's when I saw them!
on_interact.105: Big, mean looking creatures. Black as night, but you could see through them! Like... ghosts!
on_interact.113: That's what I said! They were like nothing I've seen before!
on_interact.119: They were four-legged... but their hooves were strange -- soft and round with little points sticking out.
on_interact.123: The hair of their coats were long and thick and shaggy, almost like a bison...
on_interact.135: They spoke to one another. Their voices were low and scratchy... like they had eaten thorns. I tried, but I couldn't understand.
on_interact.153: One lifted its head, sniffed the air with his pointed nose. I was hidden in the grass -- I know I was, but...
on_interact.160: That's when they all whipped around and stared straight at me!
on_interact.164: The biggest one croaked out... "GRASS EATER"!!!
on_interact.180: ... That's not a bad word, is it? Am I allowed to say that...?
on_interact.197: I ran! They came straight at me!
on_interact.202: I saw *teeth*! Sharp like I've never seen before!
on_interact.206: I ran and ran until my legs almost gave out!
on_interact.213: But before I knew it, they had me completely surrounded...
on_interact.217: There was drool coming out of their mouths, and an awful smell.
on_interact.221: They growled from all around me, "The KEY! Take us to THE KEY!"
on_interact.225: I... thought I was a goner...
on_interact.235: The dawn! A big beam of morning light hit them and they turned to smoke!
on_interact.241: As the big one was fading away, he hissed in a way I could finally understand...
on_interact.245: The Predators return. And we will be...
on_interact.257: Then, gone. Just... blown away in the wind.
on_interact.261: ... I told my chief what happened. Her face - and stripes - turned white!
on_interact.265: That's when... she brought me here.
on_interact.271: ..... So then. Thank you for your story, young one.
on_interact.280: Council Chief! The foal's account lines up with the other reports. She is lucky to remain unscathed...
on_interact.286: Indeed... and now we know they're looking for a Key...
on_interact.292: And now you can no longer deny it, Anga. The legends are true!
on_interact.299: Oh you and your legends again. Don't be a fool, old man.
on_interact.306: This Key they seek is real, so the legends must be, too!
on_interact.313: Somewhere, there is a mystic door keeping our ancient enemies, The Predators, at bay. You are all fools if you do not heed this warning!
on_interact.318: I propose we find the bravest, strongest, most skilled amongst us to find The Key... we must name a champion!
on_interact.324: Children's fairy tale or no, I admit... this threat must be taken seriously. We shall find this Key, whatever it is.
on_interact.329: After years of discord, I know that the Ungulates of Foenum will not agree on a single champion. So we must settle this as we did in times of old...
on_interact.343: Antelopians from The Valley, Whitetail of The Forest, Goatani of The Islands, Bisenne of The Plains, Equines of The Steppes, and all the other proud nations of Foenum...
on_interact.347: Choose your own champion! Send them on the quest for this legendary Key. It will be their duty to battle against each other, horn against hoof against antler!
on_interact.351: Until one champion, and one alone, remains. Whoever that Ungulate is will have proven themselves worthy to be the Protector of Foenum...
on_interact.361: We must find the strongest of us all to face this threat. For if we fail...
on_interact.365: All of Foenum shall surely perish...
